Bio: Ph.D. from Cornell University, advised by Prof. Kilian Q. Weinberger and Prof. Bharath Hariharan. Research focuses on computer vision and perception for self-driving.

I am a CS PhD student at Cornell University working at the intersection of Machine Learning, Computer Vision, and Graphics. My research focuses on 3D reconstruction, relighting, and scene understanding under occlusion.
ML Lead at TestSavant.AI, working on AI security platform. Focused on efficient AI systems and deep learning theory.
PhD student at Dalhousie University in Halifax, working on Reinforcement Learning and Machine Learning.
Full-Stack Developer with a deep interest in Large Language Models (LLMs) and Computer Vision. Focused on developing AI-driven solutions, with ongoing research in prompt security and AI guardrails.

PhD student at Cornell University working in Graphics and Vision. Previously Research Fellow at Microsoft Research India. Completed undergraduate from IIIT Delhi, majoring in Computer Science and Applied Mathematics.
